item.title: Francis add a quote by Ray Bradbury
Francis add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "The degree of civilization in a society can be judged by entering its prisons." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Francis add a quote by Lyndon Baines Johnson
item.description: "Books and ideas are the most effective weapons against intolerance and ignorance." -- Lyndon Baines Johnson

item.title: Francis add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "A nation that continues year after year to spend more money on military defense than on programs of social uplift is approaching spiritual doom." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Francis add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Francis add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Not only will we have to repent for the sins of bad people; but we also will have to repent for the appalling silence of good people." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Francis add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power. We have guided missiles and misguided men." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Francis add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Wars are poor chisels for carving out peaceful tomorrows." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Francis add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Francis add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "An individual has not started living until he can rise above the narrow confines of his individualistic concerns to the broader concerns of all humanity." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Francis add a quote by Robert Francis Kennedy
item.description: "There are those who look at things the way they are and ask why... I dream of things that never were, and ask why not?" -- Robert Francis Kennedy

item.title: Francis add a quote by Hubert H. Humphrey
item.description: "Compassion is not weakness, and concern for the unfortunate is not socialism." -- Hubert H. Humphrey

item.title: Francis add a quote by Robert F. Kennedy
item.description: "I believe that, as long as there is plenty, poverty is evil. Government belongs wherever evil needs an adversary and there are people in distress." -- Robert F. Kennedy

item.title: Francis add a quote by Robert F. Kennedy
item.description: "Lets dedicate ourselves to what the ancient greeks wrote so many years ago, to tame the savageness of man and make gentle the life of this world. Let us dedicate ourselves to that" -- Robert F. Kennedy

item.title: Francis add a quote by Robert F. Kennedy
item.description: "Ultimately, America's answer to the intolerant man is diversity, the very diversity which our heritage of religious freedom has inspired." -- Robert F. Kennedy

item.title: Francis add a quote by Hubert H. Humphrey
item.description: "Freedom is hammered out on the anvil of discussion, dissent, and debate." -- Hubert H. Humphrey

item.title: Francis add a quote by Hubert H. Humphrey
item.description: "Unfortunately, our affluent society has also been an effluent society." -- Hubert H. Humphrey

item.title: Francis add a quote by Hubert H. Humphrey
item.description: "The right to be heard does not automatically include the right to be taken seriously." -- Hubert H. Humphrey

item.title: Francis add a quote by Hubert H. Humphrey
item.description: "It was once said that the moral test of government is how that government treats those who are in the dawn of life, the children; those who are in the twilight of life, the elderly; and those who are in the shadows of life, the sick, the needy, and the handicapped." -- Hubert H. Humphrey

item.title: Francis add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Francis add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Francis add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The last thing I ever wanted was to be alive when the three most powerful people on the whole planet would be named Bush, Dick and Colon." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Francis add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "The French have a new president, the British will soon have a new P.M., and we envy them as we endure the endless wait for this small dim man to go back to Texas and resume his life." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Francis add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed. This world in arms is not spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children. This is not a way of life at all in any true sense. Under the clouds of war, it is humanity hanging on a cross of iron." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Francis add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "I ask you to judge me by the enemies I have made." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Francis add a quote by Franklin Delano Roosevelt
item.description: "A war of ideas can no more be won without books than a naval war can be won without ships. Books, like ships, have the toughest armor, the longest cruising range, and mount the most powerful guns." -- Franklin Delano Roosevelt

item.title: Francis add a quote by Franklin Delano Roosevelt
item.description: "We have always known that heedless self interest was bad morals, we now know that it is bad economics." -- Franklin Delano Roosevelt

item.title: Francis add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "A conservative is a man with two perfectly good legs who, however, has never learned to walk forward." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Francis add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much; it is whether we provide enough for those who have too little." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Francis add a quote by Plato
item.description: "The heaviest penalty for declining to rule is to be ruled by someone inferior to yourself." -- Plato
